work.name: Smile Symbol
work.summary: Fine-tuned segmentation model for dental imaging.

research.name: Independent Project: Spoken Farsi Text Dataset
research.summary: Curated the largest colloquial Farsi text dataset scraped from social media platforms Telegram and Twitter amassing 150 GB. Wrote a Python program that explores social media public channels, validates the language, and scrapes relevant documents. Cleaned the data by removing usernames, email addresses, and advertising posts.

research.name: Farsi Roberta for Toxicity Detection
research.summary: Benchmarked the performance of various subword, word, and sentence tokenizers on Farsi according to their compression factor. Designed a morphological parser that normalizes Farsi text to handle unclear word boundaries, resulting in 10% F-scores improvement in Farsi classification tasks. Trained a toxicity detection model on my model, PersianRoberta. Achieved model F-scores of 97% for offensive language and 91% for toxicity, surpassing state-of-the-art models. Deployed toxicity detection model on farsiai.com and Balatarin, a Farsi social media website.
highlights: Mentored by Dr. Mehdi Yahyanejad and Dr. Lucas Dixon

research.name: Independent Project: Roberta LLM for Farsi
research.summary: Cleaned, normalized, and segmented over 50GB of scraped Farsi text by pre-tokenizing special characters, detecting and removing non-Farsi text, cleaning punctuation, and more. Labeled scraped tweets for offensive language detection. Built custom Roberta LLM in TF2.0 with graph execution support and trained on GCP TPUs for 22 days (10 M iterations).

research.name: Machine Learning Research Assistant
research.summary: Wrote generalized end-to-end pipeline in PyTorch to fine-tune LLMs for political ideology and hate speech classification using 10K+ social media posts, including preprocessing and tokenization pipeline for scraped data. Achieved F-scores of 92% on ideology classification and 83% on offensive language detection through experimentation with BERT and XLMR, surpassing state-of-the-art results.

education.institution: National Organization for Development of Exceptional Talents (Sampad)

awards.title: Iranian National Olympiad of Informatics Finalist
awards.summary: Advanced to the final round of the 2015 Iranian National Olympiad of Informatics, as a freshman.
